alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Putnam (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Putnam and west central Hancock Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Rockville, or near Eatonton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Eatonton, Rockville, Oconee Springs Park, Plant Harlee Branch and Devereux. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
